identificationModule.briefTitle: Effects of Novel Game Rehabilitation System on Upper Extremity Function of Patients With Stroke
identificationModule.officialTitle: Effects of Novel Game Rehabilitation System (E-glove System) on Upper Extremity Function of Patients With Stroke :Randomized Controlled Trial

collaborators.name: Ministry of Trade, Industry & Energy, Republic of Korea
National IT Industry Promotion Agency, Republic of Korea

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to determine whether novel upper extremity rehabilitation system for patients with stroke(e-glove system) are effective in the rehabilitation compared to conventional occupational therapy

armGroups.label: E-glove system
armGroups.description: E-glove rehabilitation system for upper extremity

interventions.name: E-glove system
interventions.description: Novel rehabilitation system using game for upper extremity rehabilitation for patients with stroke

primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Change from baseline in Fugl-Meyer assessment at 4 weeks after intervention

secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline, after 10th intervention, after 20th intervention, 1 month after intervention
Baseline, after 10th intervention, after 20th intervention, 1 month after intervention
Baseline, after 10th intervention, after 20th intervention, 1 month after intervention

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Modified Ashworth scale of affected upper extremity
Medical research council scale of muscle strength of affected upper extremity

secondaryOutcomes.description: only for the participants of E-glove intervention

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Hemiplegic stroke patients
* Medical research council scale \>= 2 of finger or wrist flexor/extensor
* Medical research council scale \>= 2 of elbow pronation/supination

Exclusion Criteria:

* Bilateral weakness of upper extremities
* Uncontrolled medical or surgical illness
* Predisposing psychological or neurological disorders
* Severe aphasia unable to communicate
* Severe cognitive impairment not to cooperate
* Severe pain impeding upper extremity rehabilitation
